properties.areaDesc: Clear Lake/Southern Lake County; Southern Sacramento Valley; Motherlode; Northern Sacramento Valley; Shasta Lake Area / Northern Shasta County; West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Northern San Joaquin Valley; Western Plumas County/Lassen Park; Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Northern Lake County; Burney Basin / Eastern Shasta County; Carquinez Strait and Delta; Central Sacramento Valley; Northeast Foothills/Sacramento Valley
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 19 at 4:06PM PST by NWS Sacramento CA
properties.description:
* Snow: 4 to 12 inches of snow expected above 5000 feet, locally
higher amounts over higher peaks. Snow levels lower to 3500 to
4500 feet Tuesday night and Wednesday with minor accumulations
expected.

* Rain: Less than a tenth in the Northern San Joaquin Valley to
around a half an inch in the Northern Sacrament Valley. Around
an inch foothill locations.

* Timing: Monday night into early Wednesday. Heaviest
precipitation expected Tuesday.

* Impacts: Wet roads, chain controls for the Trans-Sierra passes.
Travel delays.

*Synopsis: A Pacific storm will bring rain and mountain snow to
interior Northern California late Monday night and Tuesday. Rain
diminishes in the Valley Tuesday night, with mountain snow
showers will linger into Wednesday.

NWSheadline: Wet Weather returns late Monday into early Wednesday
